Key.English: The Repair Specialist responsible for keeping vehicles operational through repairing and maintaining them.
The Medic is responsible for keeping his squad in the fight through treating and reviving his squad mates.
The Engineer has the combined features of both Repair Specialists and Explosive Specialists.
The Team Leader takes command of a small team in the field. Gets access to Light Anti Tank weaponry and Grenade Launchers
The Squad Leader takes command of an infantry squad, utilising all members to achieve the objectives. Gets access to Light Anti Tank weaponry and Grenade Launchers
The Explosive Specialist can track and defuse explosives, as well as setup explosives to aid his team.
The Sniper has access to long range weaponry and ghillie suits to assist friendlies from afar.
The Spotter aids the Sniper by choosing targets and acting as close protection.
The Pilot is responsible for transporting troops, vehicles and supplies around the AO. They can also fly CAS Missions to assist friendlies on the ground.
The UAV Operator can command UAV's and UGV's to assist friendly forces.
The Marksman provides accurate medium- to long-range fire support, bridging the gap between rifleman and sniper.
The Heavy Anti-Tank (HAT) Specialist is equipped to destroy armored threats using high-powered launchers and guided munitions.
The Light Anti-Tank (LAT) Specialist engages light armor and fortified positions using portable launchers and disposable rockets.
The Automatic Rifleman lays down suppressive fire with a light machine gun, enabling teammates to maneuver under cover.
The Grenadier provides indirect fire support using a grenade launcher to suppress enemies, clear buildings, and deny cover.
The JTAC (Joint Terminal Attack Controller) coordinates airstrikes and artillery, acting as the crucial link between ground forces and supporting firepower.
The Mortarman operates indirect fire systems to provide sustained bombardment and area denial at long ranges.
